[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Constant: DEALT_PK_NUM_BYTES] [Cross-platform consistency] Is DEALT_PK_NUM_BYTES the same value on 32-bit vs 64-bit platforms, or could platform differences cause serialization incompatibilities? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Struct: DealtPubKey] [Persistence] When DealtPubKey is persisted to storage and later deserialized, could storage corruption or bitflips cause invalid dealt keys to be loaded, breaking DKG state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Struct: DealtPubKey] [State transition consistency] During DKG epoch transitions, do all validators maintain consistent dealt public keys, or could timing issues cause some validators to use old keys while others use new ones? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Struct: DealtPubKey] [Group operation closure] Are all group operations on dealt public keys guaranteed to stay within the correct prime-order subgroup, or could operations accidentally move to unsafe subgroups? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Struct: DealtPubKey] [Neutral element handling] If g_a is the identity element (point at infinity), do all subsequent operations handle it correctly without dividing by zero or causing mathematical errors? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Function: new()] [Scalar multiplication] Is there validation that g_a was created via proper scalar multiplication g^a rather than arbitrary point selection, preventing backdoored dealt keys? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Struct: DealtPubKey] [Threshold compatibility] Does DealtPubKey properly support both weighted and unweighted PVSS threshold schemes, or could threshold parameter mismatches cause reconstruction failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Struct: DealtPubKey] [Player identification] Is there any mechanism to cryptographically bind a dealt public key to the specific PVSS dealer/player, or could attackers replay dealt keys from other sessions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Struct: DealtPubKey] [Session binding] Does the dealt public key include any session identifier or auxiliary data binding, or could transcripts be replayed across different DKG sessions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Trait: ValidCryptoMaterial] [Key derivation] Could the absence of standard PublicKey trait implementation cause issues when dealt public keys need to be derived or used in standard cryptographic protocols? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Macro: dealt_pub_key_impl!] [Scope pollution] Could the macro's use statements pollute the enclosing module scope, causing unexpected name resolution or type confusion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/dealt_pub_key.rs] [Struct: DealtPubKey] [Cross-implementation testing] Has interoperability been tested between dealt public keys serialized by different BLS12-381 library implementations to ensure consensus compatibility? (High)
